trigger_event: In the quiet of closing hours, after an anxious conversation with Alex the bartender, Nikola realizes the city is on the verge of chaos: vital services are failing, BCI scores misfire, and rumors of Council paralysis run wild.
dilemma: Nikola must decide whether to pull a secret lever that will reboot the system into its old, rigid protocols—restoring order but reviving BCI’s harshest, outdated standards—or slip the means for a risky algorithmic fix to trusted Innovator allies, potentially unleashing unpredictable social upheaval.
reason: Nikola knows neither option is safe: one means immediate stability at great social cost, the other risks disorder but offers a chance for genuine adaptation. His history with the Council, sense of personal responsibility, and wary trust in progress all weigh heavily—as does the memory of Alex’s warning that sometimes an honest mess is better than a beautiful lie.
choice_a: Trigger the obsolete fallback mode, restoring harsh old rules but bringing the city to rigid order.
belief_a: Order is preferable to chaos, even if the rules are flawed.
Strict boundaries prevent panic and larger harm.
Old systems, while imperfect, at least provide predictability in crisis.
choice_b: Enable Innovator engineers to alter the BCI, gambling on inventive fixes even if it sparks social chaos.
belief_b: Real progress requires risk—even if it means temporary instability.
The city won’t survive unless the system evolves.
Trust in capable hands is better than clinging to past certainties.
